definition.name: NXcs_computer
definition.doc: Base class for reporting the description of a computer

field.name: name
field.doc: Given name/alias to the computing system, e.g. MyDesktop.

field.name: operating_system
field.doc: Name of the operating system, e.g. Windows, Linux, Mac, Android.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version plus build number, commit hash, or description of an ever persistent resource where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured in such a manner that the result file is ideally recreatable yielding the same results.

field.name: uuid
field.doc: Ideally a (globally) unique persistent identifier of the computer, i.e. the Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the computing node.

group.name: processing
group.doc: Details about the system of processing units e.g. (classical) processing units (CPUs), coprocessor, graphic cards, accelerator processing units or a system of these.

Granularizing the processing units. Typical examples, a desktop computer with a single CPU one could describe using one instance of NXcircuit. A dual-socket server one could describe using two instances NXcircuit A server with two dual-socket server nodes one could describe with four instances of NXcircuit surplus a field with their level in the hierarchy.

field.name: type
field.doc: General type of the processing unit

group.doc: Granularizing the components of the memory system.

field.name: technology
field.doc: Qualifier for the type of random access memory.

field.name: max_physical_capacity
field.doc: Total amount of data which the medium can hold.

group.doc: Granularizing the components of the I/O system.

field.name: technology
field.doc: Qualifier for the type of storage medium used.

field.name: max_physical_capacity
field.doc: Total amount of data which the medium can hold.
